intro: Toquera, commonly known as the "tree of life," is a species of flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its woody structure and large, palmate leaves. The plant produces showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. Toquera is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits. Its resilience to harsh environmental conditions makes it an important plant in arid and semi-arid regions.
